_exec_summary.SummaryText:
U.S. EPA RMP

Executive Summary:



 The Whirlpool, Ottawa, Ohio facility has recently installed a 6,565-gallon (85% capacity max.) LPG tank and piping for the purpose of storing Isobutane (2-Methylpropane), CAS # 75-28-5. The end use of Isobutane is for the purpose of charging refrigerators and freezers at the Ottawa plant.  



(a): Accidental release prevention and emergency response policies at source,



Accident Prevention:

The AST/Bulkhead is protected to the East and South by a large retention pond with a driveway/parking area to the North and West.



A 8' chain link fence has been installed around the main property with a coded gate and around the AST/Bulkhead to prevent unauthorized access,



Jersey barriers have been installed every 6' to eliminate an accidental or intentional vehicle strike,



An emergency shutoff is located on the tank, bulkhead and various locations throughout the systems including at the end use, charging station.



A handheld LEL/O2 meter is used during offloading and repair operations. It's bump tested per/use with the technician trained in its use including proper placement for monitoring.

In the event of a fire, the tanks have a certified 3 stage relief/blow off valve in place to prevent a BLEVE.



There are Drager PIR 7000 OV/LEL meters placed and various positions within the tank, bulkhead and charging cells. They are set to alarm at 10% of the LEL and at 25% level it automaticly implements a flow shutdown of the Isobutane. It also send a signal to the security desk who would immediacy notify the shift Emergency Coordinator.



Only trained and authorized personnel are permitted to enter the AST's exclusion zone.



All tools shall be non-sparking with radios/cell phones certified to use in a Zone 2, Group 2, A zone.



There are flags located on the south side of the facility and a  wind direction sock mounted on the roof which will be used for the purpose of guiding evacuees and/or First Responders. 



Accident Prevent

ion Policies;



An inspection matrix includes daily, weekly, monthly (EHS Lead, PSM Lead and Maintenance Lead). In addition we shall implement a yearly PSM/RMP audit.



In conjunction with Gas Innovations we have developed an Offloading SOP with a detailed checklist that both the delivery driver and assigned Whirlpool associate will be required to follow.

R600A/C4H10 specific Lockout-Tagout procedures,



Line Breaking Standard Operating Procedure,



Hot Work Permit and policies,



R600A Specific HAZ-COMM training,



Management of Change policy, permit and checklist,



Calibration and use of the handheld LEL/O2 dectector. Each of the Drager PIR's are bump tested weekly.



Mandatory training is required in the above-mentioned subject prior to the associate being permitted to enter/work on the R600A system. 



All personnel associated with he R600A/Isobutane system have been formally trained in their tasks as such; Maintenance, Operator, Air Monitoring and Emergency Coordinators.

There are 



(b): Station source and regulated substances handled,



6,565 gallon Above Ground Storage Tank (AST), that will be filled to 85% capacity maximum with;

R600A, Isobutane ((2-Methylpropane),  CAS # 75-28-5



(c); General accidental release program and chemical specific steps,'

The initial step regardless of the release volume is to evacuate personnel out of the building with rally points to the west and north outside of the BLEVE zone.



In the event of a small/incidental release there are multiple ball valves inline that can be shut down to stop the flow of C4H10. At which time automatic evacuation fans (intrinsically safety) would vacuum out any fugitive vapors. Once the LEL is below 10% maintenance personnel may enter to repair.



For a large, catastrophic release all personnel would be evacuated to the rally points and the Ottawa Fire Department notified via 911. Their response time is estimated at <5 minutes. Their Incident Commander (IC) would take over contr

ol of the release and notification of off-site resources. 



(d): Five-year accident history. 

N/A New installation.
